Class JavaEvaluator

java.lang.Object
comp3607project.JavaEvaluator
public class JavaEvaluator extends Object
The JavaEvaluator class is responsible for evaluating Java classes based on defined strategies and criteria. It uses various strategies to assess classes, generate scores, and provide feedback. Observers can track the evaluation process, and a report is generated upon completion.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    JavaEvaluator()
    Constructs a new JavaEvaluator with predefined test and feedback mappings.

    • setStudentDirectory

      public void setStudentDirectory(Path studentDirectory)
      Sets the directory containing student submissions.
      Parameters:
      studentDirectory - the path to the student directory.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(EvaluationObserver observer)
      Adds an observer to monitor the evaluation process.
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer to be added.

    • inspect

      public void inspect(List<Class<?>> classInstances, String[] studentInfo, Path subDirectory)
      Inspects and evaluates the provided list of class instances.

      This method evaluates classes based on their type using the corresponding evaluation strategy, generates scores and feedback, and produces a final report.

      Parameters:
      classInstances - a list of class instances to be evaluated.
      studentInfo - an array of student information (e.g., name, ID).
      subDirectory - the path to the subdirectory for saving the report.

    • getObservers

      public List<EvaluationObserver> getObservers()
      Returns the list of registered observers.
      Returns:
      a list of EvaluationObserver objects.

    • getReportGenerator

      public PDFGenerator getReportGenerator()
      Returns the PDF generator used for report generation.
      Returns:
      the PDFGenerator instance.

    • getScoreCalculator

      public ScoreCalculator getScoreCalculator()
      Returns the score calculator used for computing total scores.
      Returns:
      the ScoreCalculator instance.
